<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/02/social-media-platforms-prepared-confusing-election-day?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It's Going to Be a Crazy Day on Social Media
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Crazy day on social media " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMDEyL2NyYXp5X2RheV9vbl9zb2NpYWxfbWVkaWEuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Once upon a time, Americans learned the results of an election when a messenger on horseback galloped into town. Eventually that turned into radio, then the dependable delivery of Walter Cronkite, and now...280 characters on Twitter.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 2020, social media platforms have become a go-to source for election information—and misinformation. So if you're one of the millions of Americans who'll be "working" today with a social media feed open on your second monitor, here's what to expect. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The run-up  </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Russian interference in the 2016 election and subsequent bouts with fake news have forced social media execs to <a href="https://qz.com/1924582/how-social-media-platforms-plan-to-curb-fake-us-election-news/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">enact new policies</a> targeting misinformation, election interference, and conspiracy theories. Changes include...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Labels:</strong></span><span> Facebook and Twitter started slapping warning signs on more false and misleading content, including posts from the president. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Advertising: </strong></span><span>Last fall, Twitter and TikTok banned all political ads. Facebook created a publicly available database for transparency and banned new ads from running this week.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Slowing virality:</strong></span><span> Twitter added extra friction to retweets, and Facebook and Instagram are lightly pressing the brake on viral content this week. So, yes, it's Zuck's fault your post only got 15 likes.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Many of these new policies are controversial, inconsistent in enforcement, and still in flux, <a href="https://onezero.medium.com/what-facebook-has-fixed-since-the-2016-election-and-what-it-hasnt-5354e9fb4227?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">OneZero reports</a>. Not all experts think it's been enough to protect voters. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Today's plan </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There's a reason Facebook calls its election ops center a "war room." Platforms have expanded their arsenals this election cycle to help voters through a confusing time.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Election hubs:</strong> Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and Snapchat are highlighting election information like where votes are still being counted, which results have been verified, and how ballot counting works. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Confirming results:</strong> Platforms are also using labels to limit candidates' abilities to prematurely declare victory when those victories aren't yet confirmed.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>What counts as official? Yesterday, Twitter said it's </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/twitter-names-7-outlets-to-call-election-results-b89a043d-ed50-4478-8d8a-de27b271ea85.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">using seven news outlets</a></span><span> with verified decision desks. It will require corroboration from at least two outlets or an announcement from state election officials.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Odds and ends: </strong>TikTok will show live Associated Press results. Pinterest is labeling or deleting content that undermines election integrity. And Facebook's WhatsApp and Messenger platforms are limiting message forwarding to prevent misinformation from going viral. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What should you do?</strong> Think twice about sharing and use the Brew's guide to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/28/5-12-steps-fact-checking-social-media-feed?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fact checking social media</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/02/companies-commit-making-easier-workers-vote-election?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Voting > Working
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As you rush to send off one last email or tidy up that spreadsheet before heading out to vote, just know you're not alone—balancing the work day with Election Day is a headache for millions of Americans. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A 2017 Pew Research survey revealed that 14% of voters </span><span><a href="https://www.foxbusiness.com/politics/companies-time-off-election-day-voting-volunteering?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">don't vote</a></span><span> because they are too busy or have scheduling conflicts. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This year, more companies are stepping up to the plate, clearing any surprise all-hands from the cal to give employees time to make it to the polls today. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>More than 1,700 organizations have joined </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/23/business/corporate-america-voting-time-off.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Time to Vote</a></span><span>, a nonpartisan initiative spearheaded by Patagonia, Levi Strauss, and PayPal that encourages employee participation in elections. Four hundred orgs were involved in 2018. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>And if "encouragement" isn't enough, employers are </span><span><a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/take-time-off-from-work-to-vote-state-guide-2020-10?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">legally required</a></span><span> to give workers time off to vote in 30 states. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>This Election Day, many employees won't have to choose between their professional and civic duties. Nearly 100 million Americans have <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/11/02/us/trump-biden-election?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">already voted</a>, more than two-thirds of the total turnout in 2016. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/02/major-mall-landlords-file-bankruptcy-amid-broader-retail-wipeout?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Mall Falls Down
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Mall meme " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMDEzL21hbGxfbWVtZS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Neal Freyman, memelord</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Two mall landlords, CBL Properties and Pennsylvania Real Estate Investment Trust (PREIT), <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/11/02/investing/mall-bankruptcies-cbl-properties-preit/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed for bankruptcy</a> on Sunday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With most brick-and-mortar retail getting walloped by the pandemic, this news was a "when, not if" scenario. More than 30 of CBL's retail tenants have also gone bankrupt this year, including JCPenney, Ann Taylor-owner Ascena Retail Group, and Pier 1 Imports. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>During the strictest lockdown periods in the spring, Tennessee-based CBL barely collected any rent—just 27% of what it was owed in April and a third in May.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Malls in general are in bad shape, but CBL and PREIT in particular? <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-11-02/malls-dragged-into-bankruptcy-by-carnage-among-retail-tenants?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Not positioned well</a>. They own so-called "B-class" malls, which are located in less affluent/less urban areas. As retailers across the country shrink their real estate footprints, experts think these B-class properties will be among the first casualties. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here...</strong>Friendly's, a Northeast diner chain and classic post-school hangout spot, also <a href="https://www.restaurantbusinessonline.com/financing/friendlys-declares-bankruptcy-will-be-sold-owner-red-mango?utm_source=Friendly%E2%80%99s%20declares%20bankruptcy%20and%20will%20be%20sold%20to%20the%20owner%20of%20Red%20Mango&utm_medium=rb-feed&utm_campaign=RSS-Feeds&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">declared bankruptcy</a>. Just writing that brought back a flood of memories. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F11%2F02%2Fmajor-mall-landlords-file-bankruptcy-amid-broader-retail-wipeout" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRENDS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/02/netflixs-queens-gambit-causing-surge-online-chess-play?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Chess Right Now
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="How do you do fellow kids meme" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84ODAvaG93X2RvX3lvdV9kb19mZWxsb3dfa2lkc19tZW1lLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>30 Rock/NBC</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As our collective obsession over a mullet-donning, big cat-peddling zoo owner earlier this year shows, Netflix has a profound ability to drive collective cultural moments. The streaming platform is at it again with <em>The Queen's Gambit,</em> a show about a fictional chess prodigy whose popularity has many viewers confronting the uncomfortable question: Is chess actually cool?</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The numbers say yes</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to data from Apptopia, daily U.S. downloads of the top four mobile chess games across the Apple and Google app stores are <a href="https://blog.apptopia.com/the-queens-gambit-penetrates-pop.-culture-and-mobile-chess-games-benefit?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">up 63%</a> since the show debuted. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Chess-mania had been building even before </span><span><em>The Queen's Gambit</em></span><span>. Hours watched of chess on the streaming platform Twitch </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/21292747/chess-twitch-games-viewership-stream-hikaru-nakamura?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">roughly doubled</a></span><span> every month from January until May. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> It is jarring to some purists that the ancient game of chess is finding new life on the backs of modern tech platforms, but those highest up in the game are <a href="https://www.wired.com/story/hikaru-nakamura-twitch-chess/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">open to it</a>. "I've always wanted to bring it to the masses," says Hikaru Nakamura, a hugely popular chess streamer on Twitch and the top-ranked blitz chess player in the world.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tech Tip Tuesday:</strong> 1) Google "how to vote" to bring up a curated block of information from Google that you can personalize by state or 2) take a breather on <a href="https://www.calm.com/breathe?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this website</a>. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Election grab bag: </strong>Four <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8Ig5vL8aygQ&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">soothing hours</a> of ballot counters counting ballots; election-fueled Google <a href="https://waves-of-interest.truth-and-beauty.net/#US?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">search trends</a>; and a <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/food/2020/11/01/national-sandwich-day-2020-deals-freebies-election-day/6089125002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">roundup</a> of deals, discounts, and freebies to celebrate after you've voted. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Follow along:</strong> Here's a long list of <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2020/10/26/fixs-2020-list-outstanding-politics-reporters-follow-every-state/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">political reporters</a> to follow in every state, plus live blogs from <a href="https://fivethirtyeight.com/live-blog/trump-biden-votes/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">FiveThirtyEight</a> and <a href="https://apps.npr.org/liveblogs/20201103-election/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NPR</a>.</p>

mso-padding-alt: 0px 15px 15px 5px;\"\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarkets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn the calm before the storm, stocks rebounded from last week's sell-off. Pro investors are looking at a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-investors/how-investors-are-gaming-out-u-s-election-night-idUSKBN27I16A?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewide variety of indicators\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, such as individual county results, to tease out whether Biden or Trump will prevail.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEconomy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGood news from the manufacturing sector, which in October \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-economy/u-s-manufacturing-near-two-year-high-road-ahead-difficult-idUSKBN27I26A?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpanded\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e at its fastest pace in two years and saw new orders hit their highest level since 2004. This is the last major economic data release before the election. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nSOCIAL MEDIA\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/02/social-media-platforms-prepared-confusing-election-day?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nIt's Going to Be a Crazy Day on Social Media\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Crazy day on social media \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMDEyL2NyYXp5X2RheV9vbl9zb2NpYWxfbWVkaWEuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOnce upon a time, Americans learned the results of an election when a messenger on horseback galloped into town. Eventually that turned into radio, then the dependable delivery of Walter Cronkite, and now...280 characters on Twitter.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 2020, social media platforms have become a go-to source for election information—and misinformation. So if you're one of the millions of Americans who'll be \"working\" today with a social media feed open on your second monitor, here's what to expect. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe run-up  \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRussian interference in the 2016 election and subsequent bouts with fake news have forced social media execs to \u003ca href=\"https://qz.com/1924582/how-social-media-platforms-plan-to-curb-fake-us-election-news/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eenact new policies\u003c/a\u003e targeting misinformation, election interference, and conspiracy theories. Changes include...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLabels:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Facebook and Twitter started slapping warning signs on more false and misleading content, including posts from the president. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAdvertising: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLast fall, Twitter and TikTok banned all political ads. Facebook created a publicly available database for transparency and banned new ads from running this week.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSlowing virality:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Twitter added extra friction to retweets, and Facebook and Instagram are lightly pressing the brake on viral content this week. So, yes, it's Zuck's fault your post only got 15 likes.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Many of these new policies are controversial, inconsistent in enforcement, and still in flux, \u003ca href=\"https://onezero.medium.com/what-facebook-has-fixed-since-the-2016-election-and-what-it-hasnt-5354e9fb4227?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eOneZero reports\u003c/a\u003e. Not all experts think it's been enough to protect voters. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eToday's plan \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere's a reason Facebook calls its election ops center a \"war room.\" Platforms have expanded their arsenals this election cycle to help voters through a confusing time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eElection hubs:\u003c/strong\u003e Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and Snapchat are highlighting election information like where votes are still being counted, which results have been verified, and how ballot counting works. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eConfirming results:\u003c/strong\u003e Platforms are also using labels to limit candidates' abilities to prematurely declare victory when those victories aren't yet confirmed.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWhat counts as official? Yesterday, Twitter said it's \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/twitter-names-7-outlets-to-call-election-results-b89a043d-ed50-4478-8d8a-de27b271ea85.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eusing seven news outlets\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e with verified decision desks. It will require corroboration from at least two outlets or an announcement from state election officials.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOdds and ends: \u003c/strong\u003eTikTok will show live Associated Press results. Pinterest is labeling or deleting content that undermines election integrity. And Facebook's WhatsApp and Messenger platforms are limiting message forwarding to prevent misinformation from going viral. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat should you do?\u003c/strong\u003e Think twice about sharing and use the Brew's guide to style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efact checking social media\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp Working\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs you rush to send off one last email or tidy up that spreadsheet before heading out to vote, just know you're not alone—balancing the work day with Election Day is a headache for millions of Americans. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA 2017 Pew Research survey revealed that 14% of voters \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.foxbusiness.com/politics/companies-time-off-election-day-voting-volunteering?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edon't vote\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e because they are too busy or have scheduling conflicts. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis year, more companies are stepping up to the plate, clearing any surprise all-hands from the cal to give employees time to make it to the polls today. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMore than 1,700 organizations have joined \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/23/business/corporate-america-voting-time-off.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eTime to Vote\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, a nonpartisan initiative spearheaded by Patagonia, Levi Strauss, and PayPal that encourages employee participation in elections. Four hundred orgs were involved in 2018. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAnd if \"encouragement\" isn't enough, employers are \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/take-time-off-from-work-to-vote-state-guide-2020-10?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elegally required\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to give workers time off to vote in 30 states. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThis Election Day, many employees won't have to choose between their professional and civic duties. Nearly 100 million Americans have \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/11/02/us/trump-biden-election?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealready voted\u003c/a\u003e, more than two-thirds of the total turnout in 2016. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith most brick-and-mortar retail getting walloped by the pandemic, this news was a \"when, not if\" scenario. More than 30 of CBL's retail tenants have also gone bankrupt this year, including JCPenney, Ann Taylor-owner Ascena Retail Group, and Pier 1 Imports. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDuring the strictest lockdown periods in the spring, Tennessee-based CBL barely collected any rent—just 27% of what it was owed in April and a third in May.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eMalls in general are in bad shape, but CBL and PREIT in particular? \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-11-02/malls-dragged-into-bankruptcy-by-carnage-among-retail-tenants?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNot positioned well\u003c/a\u003e. They own so-called \"B-class\" malls, which are located in less affluent/less urban areas. As retailers across the country shrink their real estate footprints, experts think these B-class properties will be among the first casualties. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we're here...\u003c/strong\u003eFriendly's, a Northeast diner chain and classic post-school hangout spot, also \u003ca href=\"https://www.restaurantbusinessonline.com/financing/friendlys-declares-bankruptcy-will-be-sold-owner-red-mango?utm_source=Friendly%E2%80%99s%20declares%20bankruptcy%20and%20will%20be%20sold%20to%20the%20owner%20of%20Red%20Mango\u0026utm_medium=rb-feed\u0026utm_campaign=RSS-Feeds\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edeclared bankruptcy\u003c/a\u003e. href=\"https://www.theverge.com/21292747/chess-twitch-games-viewership-stream-hikaru-nakamura?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eroughly doubled\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e every month from January until May. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom
